intro: Hibbertia cunninghamii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and woodland areas. Hibbertia cunninghamii is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with simple, alternate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like birds and insects.
